verses.roman:
'ei dravye eta svāda kāhāṅ haite āila?
kṛṣṇera adharāmṛta ithe sañcārila'

synonyms: ei dravye—in these ingredients; eta—so much; svāda—taste; kāhāṅ—where; haite—from; āila—has come; kṛṣṇera—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; adhara-amṛta—nectar from the lips; ithe—in this; sañcārila—has spread.
translation: Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu considered, "Where has such a taste in this prasāda come from? Certainly it is due to its having been touched by the nectar of Kṛṣṇa's lips."
